articles.title: Coronavirus: 100 days of global upheaval
articles.description: In the three months since China first came across a new coronavirus, the world has been plunged into turmoil.
articles.content:
In the three months since China first came across a new coronavirus, the world has been plunged into turmoil.

articles.author: Laura Hogan
articles.title: 67 coronavirus clusters recorded in nursing homes
articles.description: Nursing homes and hospitals have seen a further increase in the number of clusters of the coronavirus.
articles.content:
Nursing homes and hospitals have seen a further increase in the number of clusters of the coronavirus.
There are 260 outbreaks of the infection, linked to 989 cases.
Nursing homes now have 67 clusters, with the vast majority of them in the east.
According … [+1281 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: China reports no new coronavirus deaths for first time
articles.description: China has reported no new coronavirus deaths for the first time since it started publishing figures in January, the National Health Commission said.
articles.content:
China has reported no new coronavirus deaths for the first time since it started publishing figures in January, the National Health Commission said.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Coronavirus deaths in England rise by 758 to 5,655
articles.description: NHS England said a further 758 people who tested positive for coronavirus have died, bringing the total number of confirmed reported deaths in hospitals in England to 5,655.
articles.content:
NHS England said a further 758 people who tested positive for coronavirus have died, bringing the total number of confirmed reported deaths in hospitals in England to 5,655, up from 4,897 at the same time on Monday.
Patients were aged between 23 and 102 year… [+299 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: UK registers daily record of 786 coronavirus deaths
articles.description: The UK has reported another 786 deaths from Covid-19 - a record number - bringing the total figure to 6,159.
articles.content:
The UK has reported another 786 deaths from Covid-19 - a record number - bringing the total figure to 6,159.
The data also shows that 55,242 people have tested positive for coronavirus, according to the Department of Health.
This has risen by 3,634 from the… [+977 chars]

articles.title: Japan to declare state of emergency over coronavirus
articles.description: Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will today declare a state of emergency in parts of the country, including Tokyo, over a spike in coronavirus infections.
articles.content:
Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will today declare a state of emergency in parts of the country, including Tokyo, over a spike in coronavirus infections.

articles.title: Coronavirus models now predict many fewer US deaths
articles.description: Two senior US health officials have said they now believe the coronavirus outbreak may kill fewer Americans than some recent projections, pointing to tentative signs that the death toll was starting to level off in New York and other hot spots.
